website_summaries.verdict: At roughly the size of a small shed, this greenhouse is a good starting place for beginners or individuals with a smaller yard.
pros: Like its big brother, the 10' x 20' GrowIT Greenhouse, this  smaller model features a translucent cover with UV protection, adequate venting, and ShelterLock technology
However, this model also includes shelving, so that everything you need to get started is included
cons: This greenhouse can be rather complicated to assemble
Set extra time aside and be prepared to be patient

customer_reviews.title: I think that you will be happy. Great product!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this greenhouse "more like a shed really". It does shade the plants, so no tomatoes or peppers will do very well. My squash and herbs LOVE it Solid construction. ( You had better take your time building it, and you should be mechanically inclined, not for the meek) It came with everything needed to utilize it, to include tie down cabling. I have 2 raised planter boxes in it. I did put down a yard of decomposed granite for a base. works awesome.
customer_reviews.author: John d

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and capable greenhouse
customer_reviews.text: It was a little harder to put together then I would have thought. You did need some tools for assembly. Other than that, matching the pieces up and putting together was relatively simple. The only fault I see with this greenhouse is the sides tend to flap up and allow cold air to come in.
customer_reviews.author: Bill B. Outdoors Guy

customer_reviews.title: Great as a pool raft  house.
customer_reviews.text: This was bought to house pool rafts during the swim season. It is very sturdy even without the shelves attached. Its also the perfect size for 2 mesh and PVC style raft holders. One thing we learned the hard way is that you MUST secure the entire greenhouse to the ground. Otherwise a strong gust of wind will toss it around like Auntie Em’s house. The spikes are extremely solid and I don’t expect we’ll be chasing it anywhere in quite a while.
customer_reviews.author: PGHRhonda

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Had purchased this as a replacement to an older (much better) version. It is 3 pieces... front with door, back with window, and a tarp over the top. They are attached with zip ties and there are definite gaps no matter how hard you try to get everything fit correctly. I could heat the old version and grow my seeds out. There is no way this would hold heat well enough to do so. The quality is much lower... Guess they needed more profit. Really disappointed since me previous shelter logic lasted so long. Already looking to replace for next year.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Allee

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great product for the price, I start all my garden plants from seed. I do not have to bring flats in the house on cool nights. First year used, do not know how long quality will last? It is constructed well for the money. Thanks, Michigander
customer_reviews.author: mdon

customer_reviews.title: Tomato House
customer_reviews.text: I live in AZ so I use this as a house to shield my tomato plants fro sun and wind. Working well. I grow indeterminate tomatoes so they grow high and I fit 6 into this house. At the far end I have a little table. I did not assemble the side tables.
customer_reviews.author: Robert C Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Mixed parts mess.
customer_reviews.text: In short, don't buy. I bought this and used the instructions to assemble. The parts were mixed. EIther the covers were too small for this. Or the poles were wrong. Two of lower rails just did not fit. The ends were too small and the cover was to short. I assembled it without six short poles, and removed one shelve and duck taped the other shelf on.
customer_reviews.author: satkins

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with the greenhouse
customer_reviews.text: I was worried about the plastic blocking the sun light. The plants actually grew better in the greenhouse compared to one just outside of the greenhouse.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worse buy EVER
customer_reviews.text: Product is the worse we have ever bought. Tent comes in 3 pieces those three piece do not come together well and many gaps. I took the photos to show. The pieces do not even touch the bars. using the zip ties you can see HUGE gap even after you "pull the top/side strings" too late in the season to buy another for our garden. I would NEVER buy this again. Poor workmanship and poor quality. We followed the directions exactly as they were written.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret Billinger

customer_reviews.title: Worth the Money
customer_reviews.text: Using this shelter to keep the rain and weather elements off of our outdoor cat house. It has done a wonderful job at keeping everything dry and has been very sturdy in the wind and rain. We do have cement blocks on each leg to secure it. It has made a huge difference in the temperature of the cat house when it dips down in the 30s. I’m so happy with our purchase!
customer_reviews.author: AmyEliza

customer_reviews.title: Nice size for planting starters.
customer_reviews.text: Good product. Assembly was straight forward, and I did it by myself in a couple of hours. It's pretty sturdy once anchored in place. The one drawback is that it's not critter-proof. (the sides do not attach all the way to ground level.)
customer_reviews.author: Mike M

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This worked great last winter, I didn't have to drag my heavy plants in and out of the house.
customer_reviews.author: Doris Poling

customer_reviews.title: Great shelter, especially for the price
customer_reviews.text: Pretty easy assembly, instructions could have been clearer or more drwgs at least.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas DuBois

customer_reviews.title: Rubbish.
customer_reviews.text: This product is rubbish. It doesn't even seal up at the bottom. Its not gonna work in Ohio winters. Even with the heater I bought.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Such

customer_reviews.title: Quick assembly and with the addition of 6 concrete blocks ...
customer_reviews.text: Quick assembly and with the addition of 6 concrete blocks as anchors (Soil too rocky to use screw in anchors) has stood up to 5 severe thunderstorms.
customer_reviews.author: J Weaver

customer_reviews.title: Good quality so far
customer_reviews.text: Good quality so far, as advertised. The tie down cables WAY to short. Had to buy new cable and cut.
customer_reviews.author: Steve and Barbara Heppe

customer_reviews.title: Holds together well
customer_reviews.text: Very good. We are using it to enclose our hot tub.
customer_reviews.author: Ann M

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up
customer_reviews.text: I can see it would be easy set up for ground level. I personably needed a little more height. For what it is , seems like a good built. ShelterLogic came through for me on a questionable part. Would buy product again.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: An absurd amount of trouble to set up and the end pieces don't even reach the ground. It will be impossible to keep the plants warm with a heater. This is the 3rd temporary greenhouse I have bought and the worst one by far.
customer_reviews.author: Diane Stevens

customer_reviews.title: Green house
customer_reviews.text: It was easy to assemble. I have not experience it in all seasons as yet but it appears adequate to survive our winters.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Croker

customer_reviews.title: nice
customer_reviews.text: Very nice, but directions are a bit confusing. Make sure you mark the front of the picture of the greenhouse with an X . As I had to redo mine. It was very easy to get confused. Pipes work the same lenght & width. Other than that pretty easy, I am somewhat handicapped & I did it by myself.
customer_reviews.author: betty ostoj

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble. I did it by myself. Repurposed it for storage area for my garden art supplies.
customer_reviews.author: madrefox

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: for the money paid it works okay but still needs a stronger covering.
customer_reviews.author: JRhine

customer_reviews.title: s a good hot house but needs a better cover
customer_reviews.text: It,s a good hot house but needs a better cover. The only e they ship is good for about one season, then it comes apart quickly. I wiz going to just buy the replacement top but the tarp was 120 and the complete hothouse was 150 s like just bought ànt new one
customer_reviews.author: joemama

customer_reviews.title: The product is sturdy. But it's not a good greenhouse
customer_reviews.text: The product is sturdy. But it's not a good greenhouse. It's more of a shelter. The temperature inside greenhouse is basically the same as outside.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Greenhouse!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome greenhouse, my vegetable and herb plants are growing very nicely while being in their new home! Sturdy design, great quality, the only complaint I have would be the metal wiring ties to add additional support at the base of the structure are not long enough. My husband and I had to get creative and thankfully we had some spare twine we used instead.
customer_reviews.author: HawkSong27

customer_reviews.title: 'The cover is too thick and the sun can't get ...
customer_reviews.text: 'The cover is too thick and the sun can't get into the plants. I had to add a light. Also, it say's right on the cover "not to be used as a greenhouse.
customer_reviews.author: gypsy

customer_reviews.title: Parts do not fit. Assembled per instructions damaged other ...
customer_reviews.text: Parts do not fit . Assembled per instructions damaged other parts. Do no not order!! Piece of S***!!! Spent an hour to assemble but last parts do not fit! Will have to spend an hour to re package to get my $78 dollars back, Not worth the hassle.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Would not buy again
customer_reviews.text: biggest disappointment was the cover did not go to ground. Also difficult to attach front door and back, I'm wondering with all the open air gaps, if my plants will make it thru the winter
customer_reviews.author: Marsha Samples

customer_reviews.title: Directions are poor at best
customer_reviews.text: Flimsy frame, pieces are not well labeled. Some of the welds are off making the pieces fit together poorly. Directions are poor at best. Drilling in some of the holes off so you cannot put together the shelves, zippers come apart easily even with little stress on them.
customer_reviews.author: HW

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good! but..
customer_reviews.text: I got mine from the website it was sturdy and has been threw 20 mph winds. but the zip-ties i got were rubbish and snapped while tightening, the tie-down cables were only a foot long. I went out to home depot and got 8 ft of cable and new zip-ties spent an extra 5 bucks. Now its working like a charm
customer_reviews.author: Mad Jeep'in

customer_reviews.title: It can with 2 back dooirs and no zipper front ...
customer_reviews.text: It can with 2 back dooirs and no zipper front door. I contacted the manufacture, but have received the zipper door.
customer_reviews.author: jacrobes

product_meta.title: ShelterLogic 6' x 8' x 6.5' GrowIT Greenhouse Peak Roof Style Backyard Grow House with Integrated Shelving, 6' x 8' x 6', Translucent
product_meta.description: Start seedlings or extend your growing season with the GrowIT 6’ x 8’ Backyard Greenhouse with Integrated Shelving from ShelterLogic. This durable and compact greenhouse unit is constructed with a high-grade steel tubular frame. Measuring 1” in diameter, the metal frame has a premium powder coat finish to help protect it from chipping, peeling, rust, and corrosion. The 5. 5 oz thick waterproof fitted PVC cover allows a significant amount of light to reach the plants, while reducing the amount of harmful UV light. This means less damage to plants as well as reduced fungus and harmful insects. GrowIT fabric is a good thermal barrier providing good insulation for plants while preventing over-heating, which requires less water, ventilation accessories, and attention. The greenhouse features integrated shelving on both sides for built-in staging of plants. The shelves feature a metal grid design, which allows for proper draining. It also has a double zipper door panel that rolls up, allowing easy walk-through access to plants and seeds. The front door and the back rear panel both have vents for maximum airflow and temperature control. The greenhouse can be assembled in about an hour and a half with 2 people. When your growing demands change, this portable greenhouse can be disassembled and transported easily. 15” auger anchors are included with your greenhouse kit for easy anchoring. See included Anchor Guide for more info. Get ready to grow with the ShelterLogic GrowIT 6’ x 8’ Backyard Greenhouse with Integrated Shelving. Whether you’re an experienced gardener or a weekend flower enthusiast, you’ll love this portable and functional greenhouse. Perfect for backyards, patios, decks, porches, and balconies. ASSEMBLED DIMENSIONS: 6' W x 8' D x 6. 5' H INCLUDED: (1) All-steel frame (1) GrowIT fabric cover (1) Double zippered front door with vent (1) Rear panel with vent Tie wrap fasteners 15” auger anchors Hardware kit (2) 4’ x 9” shelving kits Instructions
feature_bullets: WALK-IN GREENHOUSE: Portable outdoor greenhouse features a translucent cover with shelving and easy walk-in access with the double zippered front door
PROTECTS PLANTS: Triple layer, heat bonded ripstop translucent cover is 5. 5 oz thick, waterproof, and UV-treated inside and out and designed specifically for plant growth and protection
REDUCES HARMFUL RAYS: Translucent fabric allows a significant amount of diffused light to reach the plants, while reducing the amount of harmful UV light
SAVES TIME AND MONEY: GrowIT fabric is a good thermal barrier providing good insulation for plants while preventing over-heating, which requires less water, ventilation accessories, and attention
DURABLE STEEL FRAME: 1-inch high-grade steel frame with premium powder coat finish resists chipping, peeling, rust and corrosion
SHELVING KIT: 4-foot shelving on sides of greenhouse building for built-in staging of plants. Metal grid shelving allows for proper drainage
ASSEMBLED DIMENSIONS: 6' W x 8' D x 6. 5' H

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars134 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
